name: Golden Gate Bridge
description: Iconic suspension bridge offering stunning views of the bay and city. Great for photos, walking, and biking.

name: Alcatraz Island
description: Former maximum-security prison, now a popular tourist attraction with audio tours detailing its history.

name: Fisherman's Wharf
description: Bustling waterfront area known for seafood restaurants, street performers, souvenir shops, and views of sea lions.

name: Golden Gate Park
description: Large urban park featuring gardens, museums (de Young, California Academy of Sciences), lakes, and walking trails.

name: The Mission District
description: Vibrant neighborhood known for its murals, diverse food scene (especially Mexican), and lively culture.

name: Coit Tower
description: Art Deco tower atop Telegraph Hill offering panoramic city views and featuring murals from the 1930s.

name: Ritual Coffee Roasters
description: Popular coffee shop known for its high-quality, meticulously sourced beans and expert brewing methods. Several locations.

name: Ferry Building Marketplace
description: Historic ferry terminal hosting a vibrant marketplace with artisanal food vendors, restaurants, and a farmers market.

name: Lombard Street
description: Famous for its steep, one-block section with eight hairpin turns, known as the 'crookedest street in the world'.

name: Palace of Fine Arts
description: Monumental structure originally constructed for the 1915 Panama-Pacific Exposition, featuring a classical rotunda and lagoon.

name: Chinatown
description: The oldest and one of the largest Chinatowns in North America, offering authentic cuisine, unique shops, and cultural experiences.

name: Painted Ladies
description: Row of colorful Victorian houses facing Alamo Square Park, famous for their appearance in TV shows and stunning city backdrop.

name: Twin Peaks
description: Two prominent hills offering spectacular 360-degree views of the city, bay, and surrounding areas.

name: Exploratorium
description: Interactive science museum with hundreds of hands-on exhibits exploring science, art, and human perception.

name: Lands End
description: Rugged coastal trail offering dramatic views of the Golden Gate Bridge, Marin Headlands, and shipwrecks visible at low tide.

name: Ghirardelli Square
description: Historic chocolate factory converted into a retail and dining complex, famous for its chocolate and ice cream.

name: Japanese Tea Garden
description: Oldest public Japanese garden in the US, featuring traditional elements like pagodas, koi ponds, and a tea house.

name: Dolores Park
description: Popular urban park with stunning city views, large grassy areas, and a vibrant social scene, especially on weekends.

name: California Academy of Sciences
description: Natural history museum featuring an aquarium, planetarium, rainforest dome, and living roof in Golden Gate Park.

name: de Young Museum
description: Fine arts museum in Golden Gate Park with a distinctive copper facade and observation tower offering panoramic views.

name: Blue Bottle Coffee
description: Renowned specialty coffee roaster known for pour-over coffee and minimalist cafes across the city.

name: Tartine Bakery
description: Acclaimed bakery in the Mission District famous for its artisanal bread, morning buns, and other pastries.

name: Muir Woods National Monument
description: Ancient coastal redwood forest just north of San Francisco with towering trees and serene hiking trails.

name: Baker Beach
description: Scenic beach with stunning views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Marin Headlands, popular for sunsets.

name: The Castro
description: Historic LGBTQ+ neighborhood known for its vibrant nightlife, cultural landmarks, and annual pride celebrations.

name: Haight-Ashbury
description: Famous neighborhood known as the birthplace of the 1960s counterculture movement, featuring vintage shops and colorful Victorian houses.

name: Sausalito
description: Charming waterfront town across the Golden Gate Bridge with art galleries, houseboats, and bay views.

name: Angel Island State Park
description: Island in the bay offering hiking trails, historical sites, and panoramic views of the San Francisco skyline.

name: Presidio
description: Former military post turned national park with forests, beaches, historic buildings, and the Walt Disney Family Museum.

name: Pier 39
description: Popular tourist destination with shops, restaurants, street performers, and a colony of sea lions.

name: Philz Coffee
description: San Francisco coffee chain known for its customized, hand-poured coffee blends and relaxed atmosphere.

name: Sutro Baths
description: Ruins of a late 19th-century bathhouse complex on the western shore, offering dramatic ocean views and hiking trails.

name: North Beach
description: Historic Italian district known for its restaurants, cafes, beatnik history, and vibrant nightlife.

name: Legion of Honor
description: Fine arts museum housed in a neoclassical building overlooking the Golden Gate Bridge, featuring European masterpieces.

name: Nob Hill
description: Upscale neighborhood featuring luxury hotels, Grace Cathedral, and cable car lines with spectacular city views.

name: Ocean Beach
description: Long, wide beach along the city's western edge popular with surfers, dog walkers, and bonfire enthusiasts.

name: Conservatory of Flowers
description: Victorian greenhouse in Golden Gate Park housing a collection of rare and exotic plants.

name: Musée Mécanique
description: Unique museum featuring a collection of antique arcade machines and mechanical musical instruments that visitors can play.

name: Sightglass Coffee
description: Independent coffee roaster with industrial-chic cafes known for single-origin beans and meticulous brewing methods.

name: Salesforce Park
description: Elevated urban park above the Salesforce Transit Center featuring gardens, walking paths, and public art.

name: The Buena Vista Cafe
description: Historic cafe famous for introducing Irish Coffee to America, located near Fisherman's Wharf.

name: Crissy Field
description: Former airfield transformed into a recreational area with beaches, picnic areas, and stunning Golden Gate Bridge views.

name: Japantown
description: Cultural district featuring Japanese restaurants, shops, the Peace Pagoda, and seasonal festivals.

name: Dandelion Chocolate
description: Bean-to-bar chocolate factory and cafe in the Mission District offering tours, classes, and decadent hot chocolate.

name: Bernal Heights Park
description: Hilltop park offering panoramic city views, dog-friendly trails, and a relaxed neighborhood vibe.

name: The Fillmore
description: Historic music venue that played a significant role in the psychedelic music scene of the 1960s, still hosting concerts today.

name: Andytown Coffee Roasters
description: Neighborhood coffee shop known for its Snowy Plover drink (espresso, sparkling water, and whipped cream) and house-roasted beans.

name: Alamo Square Park
description: Urban park famous for its view of the Painted Ladies Victorian houses with the downtown skyline in the background.

name: Anchor Brewing Company
description: America's oldest craft brewery offering tours and tastings of its traditional steam beer and other brews.

name: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (SFMOMA)
description: Renowned modern art museum with an impressive collection spanning painting, sculpture, photography, and digital media.

name: Bi-Rite Creamery
description: Beloved ice cream shop known for small-batch, locally sourced flavors like salted caramel and honey lavender.

name: Corona Heights Park
description: Hilltop park featuring dramatic rock outcroppings and panoramic views of the city and bay.

name: The Interval at Long Now
description: Unique bar, cafe, and museum showcasing mechanical wonders and artifacts related to long-term thinking.

name: Fort Point
description: Civil War-era fortress located directly beneath the Golden Gate Bridge, offering historical exhibits and unique bridge views.

name: Four Barrel Coffee
description: Hip coffee roaster in the Mission with a vintage aesthetic, known for single-origin beans and vinyl records playing in-store.

name: Yerba Buena Gardens
description: Urban oasis in downtown featuring landscaped lawns, public art, museums, and the historic carousel.

name: The Tonga Room & Hurricane Bar
description: Iconic tiki bar in the Fairmont Hotel featuring tropical drinks, Asian cuisine, and indoor rainstorms over a lagoon.

name: Seward Street Slides
description: Concrete slides built into a hillside park where visitors can slide down on cardboard pieces.

name: Boudin Bakery
description: San Francisco's oldest continuously operating business, famous for its sourdough bread made with a Gold Rush-era starter.

name: 16th Avenue Tiled Steps
description: Community art project featuring a sea-to-stars themed mosaic stairway leading to stunning city views.

name: The Wave Organ
description: Acoustic sculpture on the bay that amplifies the sounds of waves through a series of pipes and chambers.

name: Trouble Coffee
description: Tiny, quirky coffee shop credited with starting the artisanal toast trend, known for cinnamon toast and coconuts.
